lessons.title: Writing your first program
masteryOutcomes: Introduce the Maestro Code Editor
Write and execute a simple Python script using the print() function

lessons.title: Unlocking print() power-ups
masteryOutcomes: Print multiple values using commas
Understand that printing is always in a new line
Print multiple text and numeric values using the + and * operators
Predict the output of a script that uses multiple print() statements

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Cafe Cashier
masteryOutcomes: Students will write a Python script that simulates a cafe cashier using the print() function to display order details and generate a simple ASCII art logo for the cafe.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Introduction to variables
masteryOutcomes: Explain that a variable is a named placeholder for a value in memory
Write a valid variable name following Python conventions
Assign a value (e.g., a number or a piece of text) to a variable using the = operator
Use the print() function to display the value stored in a variable

lessons.title: Working with text
masteryOutcomes: Define a "data type" as a category of data that determines what you can do with it
Create a string variable by enclosing text in single (') or double (") quotes
Combine two strings using the + operator (concatenation)
Predict the output when printing string variables

lessons.title: Working with numbers
masteryOutcomes: Distinguish between an integer (int, a whole number) and a float (float, a number with a decimal)
Create variables to store integer and float values
Perform basic arithmetic operations (+, -, *, /) on numeric variables
Explain why 5 is different from "5"

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: To-Do List
masteryOutcomes: Students will create a simple to-do list program using variables to store tasks and their priorities, demonstrating string concatenation and basic arithmetic with indices.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Checking the facts
masteryOutcomes: Use the type() function to check the data type of a variable's value
Correctly identify str, int, and float types in the output of the type() function
Explain the purpose of the type() function as a way to understand your data

lessons.title: Understanding type errors and f-strings
masteryOutcomes: Identify and explain a TypeError that occurs when attempting to combine incompatible data types (e.g., print("Age: " + 25))
Embed variables of any type directly inside a string using f-string syntax (f"...")
Combine text and variables to produce a clean, readable, and dynamic output

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Age Verification
masteryOutcomes: Students will write a program that checks the data type of user input for age, uses f-strings to format output, and demonstrates type casting to handle input correctly.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Type casting
masteryOutcomes: Use the str(), int(), and float() functions to convert values between data types
Predict the outcome of valid type conversions (e.g., int("123"))
Identify cases where a conversion will fail and result in a ValueError (e.g., int("hello"))

lessons.title: Create your personal profile
masteryOutcomes: Define and use variables of str, int, and float types to represent personal data (e.g., name, age, hourly_rate)
Use the type() function to verify the data types of the created variables
Use f-strings to combine all the variables into a multi-line, well-formatted "profile card" output
Write a short, commented script that is readable and error-free

lessons.title: Create the bot's logo
masteryOutcomes: Articulate the overall goal of the project: to build a multi-part, text-based bot
Design a simple but unique visual pattern using multiple print() statements
Combine strings and special characters to create a multi-line ASCII art logo
Write clean, readable code for the visual component of the final script

lessons.title: Give the bot a skill
masteryOutcomes: Use variables to store and manipulate numerical data
Perform a multi-step arithmetic calculation using the variables you created
Use an f-string to embed the results of the calculation into a clean, human-readable sentence

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Personal Profile Card
masteryOutcomes: Students will create a personal profile card using variables to store their name, age, and hourly rate, and format the output using f-strings and multi-line print statements.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Assemble your bot
masteryOutcomes: Synthesize code from previous lessons into a single, sequential Python script
Add comments (#) to explain the different sections of the program (logo, introduction, calculation)
Execute a complete, multi-part program that runs without errors from top to bottom

lessons.title: Expressions and operator precedence
masteryOutcomes: Control the order of expression evaluation in Python through operator precedence and parentheses.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Chatbot Assembly
masteryOutcomes: Students will assemble a simple chatbot program that combines previous concepts, includes comments for clarity, and executes a complete sequence of operations without errors.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Updating values and printing expressions
masteryOutcomes: Update numeric variables with compound assignment (+=, -=) and predict final values
Print expressions that mix numbers and text (via commas) and explain the output behavior.

lessons.title: Modeling real-world calculations
masteryOutcomes: Translate a two-step word problem into an arithmetic expression and compute the result
Do arithmetic directly inside print() to produce clear, useful outputs
Compare two equivalent formulations and choose the clearer one.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Cash Register Calculation
masteryOutcomes: Students will apply arithmetic operations and division modes to calculate the total amount due in a café setting, reinforcing their understanding of numeric variables and expressions.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Division modes: / vs // with quotient and remainder
masteryOutcomes: Compute and contrast true division (/) and floor division (//) on integers
explain the difference
Use // and % together to derive quotient and remainder for practical cases (e.g., packing/scheduling).

lessons.title: Modulo in practice: parity, cycles, positions
masteryOutcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Rounding, and money format
masteryOutcomes: Use round(x, n) to control numeric precision
Format prices with f"{x:.2f}" as a quick money-format (value vs representation).

lessons.title: Talking to your program: getting input from users
masteryOutcomes: Explain why programs interact with users and when input() is appropriate
collect input with clear prompts
Convert numeric inputs to the correct type before computing and print a friendly summary.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Shopping List Formatter
masteryOutcomes: Students will create a program that formats prices using rounding and modulo to manage item positions, enhancing their skills in user input and numeric formatting.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Functions i: why, define, and call
masteryOutcomes: Understand how functions reduce repetition and improve reuse
Understand the structure of Python functions
Define a function with one or two parameters and call it with literals and variables.

lessons.title: Functions ii: Inside the function
masteryOutcomes: Understand the structure of a function, including its name, parameters, indentation, and return value
Call functions with arguments correctly and trace how values are passed from the call site to parameters, verifying the flow using print statements.

lessons.title: Functions iii: return vs print and early return
masteryOutcomes: Differentiate printing vs returning values
Use return to pass results and apply early returns.

lessons.title: Scope and local variables
masteryOutcomes: Understand that variables created inside a function exist only within that function’s scope (local)
Explain how local and global scopes differ and identify when each is used
Demonstrate how data can be passed into functions through parameters instead of relying on global variables

lessons.title: Python errors: meet the traceback
masteryOutcomes: Identify key parts of a traceback, including the error type, and a short explanation of what went wrong.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Recipe Portion Adjuster
masteryOutcomes: Students will define and call functions to adjust ingredient quantities based on different serving sizes, solidifying their understanding of function structure and parameter use.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: User Profile Manager
masteryOutcomes: Students will build a program that manages user profiles, demonstrating the concept of variable scope and local variables by passing data through function parameters.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Introduction to debugging
masteryOutcomes: Define debugging as the process of finding and fixing errors in a program
Use print statements to observe variable values and trace the program’s flow step by step
Insert and remove targeted print statements to test assumptions and confirm how the code behaves.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Café receipt
masteryOutcomes: Create a program that acts as a mini receipt calculator.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Bug Tracker
masteryOutcomes: Students will implement a debugging process to identify and fix errors in a simple program, enhancing their understanding of debugging techniques and error tracebacks.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Control flow overview: decisions vs repetition
masteryOutcomes: Identify when a task requires selection (if/else) versus repetition (loop) and provide an example of each
Write a 3–5 line text-only flow outline in comments and map each line to if/else or loop constructs.

lessons.title: If/else: syntax, indentation, mental model
masteryOutcomes: Introduce indentation as Python’s rule for defining code blocks
Write a basic if/else using comparison operators (==, !=, <, >, <=, >=)
Differentiate assignment (=) from equality (==) in conditions.

lessons.title: Logical operators: and/or/not and short-circuiting
masteryOutcomes: Combine comparisons with and, or, not to form compound conditions
Show short-circuit behavior by adding prints to the right-hand side expression.

lessons.title: Booleans and comparisons: equality vs identity
masteryOutcomes: Use True/False in expressions and store boolean results in variables
Differentiate between '==' (value equality) and 'is' (identity equality)

lessons.title: String membership with 'in' in conditions
masteryOutcomes: Test substring membership with 'in' and negate with 'not in'
Use membership checks inside if/elif branches to drive simple decisions.

lessons.title: Elif and refactoring nested decisions
masteryOutcomes: Refactor a nested if/else into an equivalent if/elif/else chain
Order conditions to avoid overlaps and unreachable branches.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Movie Recommendation
masteryOutcomes: Participants will develop a movie recommendation system that uses boolean comparisons and string membership to suggest films based on user preferences.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Decision tables to branching logic
masteryOutcomes: Translate a 3–5 row decision table into clear if/elif/else code
Verify mutual exclusivity and completeness of the conditions.

lessons.title: For loops and range(): counting iterations
masteryOutcomes: Write for loops with range(stop), range(start, stop), range(start, stop, step)
Accumulate a total across iterations and print the result
Generate even/odd sequences and countdowns with range.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Countdown Timer
masteryOutcomes: Participants will implement a countdown timer that utilizes loops to repeatedly display the remaining time until it reaches zero.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Meet the while loop
masteryOutcomes: Understand what a while loop is and when it is more suitable than for
Understand the risk of infinite loops and explain how to prevent them
Write a while loop to repeat actions until a condition changes.

lessons.title: Loop control: break and continue
masteryOutcomes: Understand when to exit a loop early with break versus letting it complete naturally
Insert break to exit early on a condition and continue to skip an iteration

lessons.title: Counters and totals
masteryOutcomes: Initialize and update a counter and running total correctly inside a loop
Print the final counts and totals after the loop completes.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Inventory Tracker
masteryOutcomes: Participants will build an inventory tracker that employs loop control to manage stock levels, using break to stop processing when inventory is depleted.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: String skills upgrade i: indexing and slicing
masteryOutcomes: Access individual characters in a string using 0-based indexing
Use slice notation [start:stop] and [start:stop:step] to extract substrings
Use negative indices to access characters from the end of a string.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Score Tracker
masteryOutcomes: Participants will create a score tracker program that prompts users for team names and scores, updating totals until a maximum score is reached.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: String skills upgrade ii: common methods
masteryOutcomes: Use strip, lower, replace, and find to clean and search text.

lessons.title: String skills upgrade iii: splitting and joining text
masteryOutcomes: Split delimited lines into fields and re-join using a chosen delimiter
Handle extra whitespace and empty fields during splitting.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Text Cleaner
masteryOutcomes: Students will apply string methods to clean and format user input by removing unnecessary whitespace and standardizing text.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: CSV Splitter
masteryOutcomes: Students will create a program that splits CSV formatted text into structured lists while handling extra whitespace and empty fields.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Lists i: creating lists
masteryOutcomes: Create lists with literals and from range()
print length with len()
Explain that lists are mutable and show a visible effect of mutation
Understand when a list is a better choice than separate variables.

lessons.title: Lists ii: indexing and slicing
masteryOutcomes: Access list elements by index and understand how indexing works
Modify list elements and create sublists using slicing
Handle out-of-range errors (IndexError) in list access

lessons.title: Lists iii: mastering list iteration
masteryOutcomes: Use a for loop with range() and len() to iterate over indices and access list elements by their position
Use a for loop to iterate directly over the values in a list and perform actions on each element.

lessons.title: Lists iv: common methods
masteryOutcomes: Modify a list in place with append, insert, remove, pop, and extend.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: List Manipulator
masteryOutcomes: Students will create a program that modifies a list of favorite movies by indexing, slicing, and applying list methods to add and remove titles.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Student Grades Manager
masteryOutcomes: Students will manage a list of student grades by iterating over the list to compute averages and modifying the list to reflect updated grades.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Ordering lists: sorted() vs .sort()
masteryOutcomes: Sort a list in place with .sort() and create a sorted copy with sorted()
Use .sorted() parameters ('key' and 'reverse') to customize ordering and explain stability.

lessons.title: Dictionaries i: keys and values
masteryOutcomes: Create dictionaries and access values by key
add and update key–value pairs
Explain valid key types and why mutability matters for keys.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Sorted Shopping List
masteryOutcomes: Students will create a shopping list program that sorts items using both `.sort()` and `sorted()`, allowing customization of the order based on user input.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Contact Dictionary
masteryOutcomes: Students will build a contact management system using dictionaries to store and retrieve names and phone numbers, practicing addition and updates of key-value pairs.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Dictionaries ii: iteration patterns
masteryOutcomes: Iterate over a dictionary’s keys, values, and key–value pairs
Select the most suitable iteration pattern (keys, values, or items) based on the task’s goal.

lessons.title: Updates and copy semantics
masteryOutcomes: Show the difference between assignment (aliasing) and shallow copy for lists and dicts
Explain that list slicing (x[:]) creates a new list independent of the original
Use list(x) / x.copy() / dict(x) appropriately to avoid unintended aliasing

lessons.title: Nested structures and safe mutation
masteryOutcomes: Access and modify data inside nested lists and dictionaries step by step
Use safe methods like get() to read values.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Playlist Organizer
masteryOutcomes: Students will create a program that demonstrates the difference between list aliasing and copying by managing a playlist of songs and showing the effects of mutations.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Nested Recipe Book
masteryOutcomes: Students will access and modify a nested dictionary of recipes, ensuring safe mutation practices while retrieving ingredients and instructions.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Parsing text to list of dicts: tokenize and map fields
masteryOutcomes: Map split fields into a dict with named keys for a single line
Extend the approach to multiple lines to build a list of dicts.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Music Library Parser
masteryOutcomes: Students will develop a parser that converts text-based song entries into a list of dictionaries, allowing for structured access to song attributes.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Playlist Manager
masteryOutcomes: Students will create a comprehensive music manager that allows users to add, remove, and sort songs, while displaying summaries based on user-defined criteria.

lessons.title: Naming that tell a story
masteryOutcomes: Demonstrate the ability to rename variables and functions to improve clarity.

lessons.title: Crafting docstrings that explain the why
masteryOutcomes: Add clear docstrings that explain the purpose and usage of functions.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Cafe Cashier
masteryOutcomes: Improve code clarity by renaming variables and functions, adding docstrings, and writing purposeful comments.

lessons.title: Writing comments with real purpose
masteryOutcomes: Add purposeful comments that explain reasoning, not obvious code behavior.

lessons.title: Keeping it clean
masteryOutcomes: Apply consistent formatting rules for whitespace, indentation, and line breaks.

lessons.title: Making code instantly readable
masteryOutcomes: Rewrite code to pass a readability checklist you define.

lessons.title: Turning long scripts into sharp functions
masteryOutcomes: Split a long script into focused functions with well-defined signatures.

lessons.title: Following program flow with print tracing
masteryOutcomes: Insert print-based tracing statements to follow program flow.

lessons.title: Using invariants as safety checkpoints
masteryOutcomes: Apply invariants to check assumptions at key points in the code.

masteryOutcomes: Implement print tracing for program flow and apply invariants to ensure assumptions hold true during execution.

lessons.title: Designing functions that can be reused anywhere
masteryOutcomes: Use parameters and return values to ensure modular, reusable design.

lessons.title: Debugging step by step
masteryOutcomes: Use a minimal debugging checklist to isolate a defect in a provided snippet.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: To-Do List App
masteryOutcomes: Enhance code readability and organization by applying consistent formatting, rewriting for clarity, and breaking down long scripts into focused functions.

lessons.title: Stress it to the edge

masteryOutcomes: Define and test clear input and output boundaries, ensuring the code behaves correctly at limits and under invalid conditions.

lessons.title: Validating inputs before they break things

lessons.title: The art of a well-placed error

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Recipe Validator
masteryOutcomes: Students will refactor a recipe function to include error messages for invalid inputs and improve code clarity.

masteryOutcomes: Perform safe refactoring moves such as renaming, extracting functions, and removing dead code.

lessons.title: Making sure nothing breaks
masteryOutcomes: Re-run tests to confirm behavior remains consistent after refactoring.

lessons.title: Grandma’s secret recipe
masteryOutcomes: Students refactor her kitchen code by splitting it into neat functions, adding docstrings that “tell the story” of the recipe steps, and validating edge cases (like zero or negative servings). They write tests to ensure the recipe always scales correctly.

lessons.title: Balancing planning and coding
masteryOutcomes: Understand the trade-offs between planning and coding immediately and how upfront planning improves clarity and reduces rework.

masteryOutcomes: Keep reference comments that connect code back to pseudocode blocks.

lessons.title: Building code incrementally

Incrementally replace stubs with working implementations.

lessons.title: Integrating logic into a full app

lessons.title: Demonstrating the working app
masteryOutcomes: Demonstrate the app working correctly for multiple test cases.

lessons.title: Escape room master plan
masteryOutcomes: Students are trapped in a virtual escape room where guessing randomly won’t work. They must map out the precise sequence of steps to solve puzzles, write pseudocode to describe the solution path, and then implement Python code that follows the plan exactly. Testing with multiple scenarios ensures their escape strategy works under pressure.

lessons.title: Writing a clear feature brief
masteryOutcomes: Write a concise paragraph that clearly defines a feature's goal, target users, and implementation context.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Music App
masteryOutcomes: Students will integrate input validation, logic, and output formatting into a music app, demonstrating its functionality through multiple test cases to confirm correct behavior.

lessons.title: Separating purpose from technical details
masteryOutcomes: Distinguish between purpose and technical details at this stage.

lessons.title: Writing a structured problem statement
masteryOutcomes: Translate a feature description into a structured Python problem statement (docstring) with success criteria and constraints.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Online Shopping Cart
masteryOutcomes: Students will write a structured problem statement for an online shopping cart feature, clearly distinguishing between its purpose and technical details while defining success criteria and constraints.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Defining example inputs and outputs
masteryOutcomes: Define concrete example inputs and expected outputs as Python literals to illustrate normal cases, edge conditions, and invalid inputs.

lessons.title: Breaking down into subproblems
masteryOutcomes: Break the problem into clear subproblems.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Cafe Order Breakdown
masteryOutcomes: Define example inputs and outputs for a cafe order system, illustrating normal, edge, and invalid cases while breaking down the ordering process into subproblems.

lessons.title: Defining subproblem inputs and outputs
masteryOutcomes: Define the input and output of each subproblem clearly.

lessons.title: Sequencing subproblems logically
masteryOutcomes: Arrange subproblems in a logical sequence and implement them in a Python script.

lessons.title: Matching subproblems to patterns
masteryOutcomes: Match subproblems to common patterns such as filter, map, or group.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: Music Playlist Organizer
masteryOutcomes: Sequence subproblems logically to create a Python script that organizes a music playlist, utilizing filtering and mapping techniques to enhance user experience.

lessons.title: Prioritizing tasks by risk
masteryOutcomes: Label tasks as risky or straightforward based on uncertainty and choose a build order that addresses risk early.

lessons.title: Explaining prioritization choices
masteryOutcomes: Explain rationale for prioritization decisions.

lessons.title: Assembling functions into pipelines
masteryOutcomes: Combine functions into pipelines where outputs feed subsequent inputs

lessons.title: Breaking down a case study
masteryOutcomes: Decompose a real-world case study into subproblems.

masteryOutcomes: Prioritize tasks in a project scenario by labeling them as risky or straightforward, and explain the rationale for your prioritization choices to optimize project flow.

lessons.title: Writing a full problem statement
masteryOutcomes: Develop a comprehensive problem statement for a simple case study and implement a complete Python solution.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Session: ars pioneers
masteryOutcomes: Students write a mission brief, identify vital inputs and outputs (oxygen, water, energy, food), and break the challenge into subproblems like life support, transport, and communication. By mapping data flow and assembling a Python pipeline, they create a structured plan that transforms survival on Mars into a working simulation.
